title: Can Drivers in Canada Be Fined $1,500 If a Passenger Uses a Cellphone?
subtitle: A website with a penchant for attention-grabbing headlines about life in Canada struck again in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: As of July 2020, a new law in Canada meant motorists could be convicted and fined $1,500 if one of their passengers used a cellphone.
